title: Cream Cheese Squares Recipe
description: These cream cheese bars are quick and easy to make with crescent roll dough layered with cream cheese and cinnamon sugar for a quick and tasty treat.

About Us The Allrecipes Allstars How to Add a Recipe GET THE MAGAZINE Recipes Desserts Cookies Bar Cookie Recipes Cream Cheese Squares 4.7 (1,591) 1,307 Reviews 193 Photos These cream cheese bars are very easy and deliciously rich and gooey. Submitted by Ann Updated on June 5, 2024 Save Rate Print Share Add Photo 193 193 193 193 Prep Time: 10 mins Cook Time: 25 mins Total Time: 35 mins Servings: 24 Yield: 24 squares Jump to Nutrition Facts Cook Mode (Keep screen awake) Ingredients 1x 2x 4x Oops! Something went wrong. Our team is working on it. Original recipe (1X) yields 24 servings 2 (8 ounce) cans refrigerated crescent roll dough 2 (8 ounce) packages cream cheese, softened 1 ¼ cups white sugar, divided 1 teaspoon vanilla extract ½ cup butter, melted 1 teaspoon ground cinnamon Directions Gather all ingredients. Dotdash Meredith Food Studios Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Grease a 9x13-inch baking pan. Unroll one can of crescent rolls and press dough into the bottom of the prepared pan. Set second can aside. Dotdash Meredith Food Studios Mix together cream cheese, 1 cup sugar, and vanilla in a medium bowl until smooth and creamy. Spread over crescent dough layer. Dotdash Meredith Food Studios Unroll second can of crescent rolls and lay dough on top of cream cheese mixture; do not press down. Pour melted butter over the entire pan. Dotdash Meredith Food Studios Combine remaining 1/4 cup sugar and cinnamon in a small bowl; sprinkle on top. Dotdash Meredith Food Studios Bake in the preheated oven until top is crisp and golden, 25 to 30 minutes. Dotdash Meredith Food Studios Once cool, cut into 24 squares. Enjoy! Dotdash Meredith Food Studios I Made It Print 2,197 home cooks made it! Nutrition Facts (per serving) 213 Calories 14g Fat 18g Carbs 3g Protein Show Full Nutrition Label Hide Full Nutrition Label Nutrition Facts Servings Per Recipe 24 Calories 213 % Daily Value * Total Fat 14g 18% Saturated Fat 6g 29% Cholesterol 21mg 7% Sodium 246mg 11% Total Carbohydrate 18g 7% Dietary Fiber 0g 0% Total Sugars 12g Protein 3g 6% Calcium 17mg 1% Iron 1mg 4% Potassium 25mg 1% * Percent Daily Values are based on a 2,000 calorie diet. Your daily values may be higher or lower depending on your calorie needs. ** Nutrient information is not available for all ingredients. Amount is based on available nutrient data. (-) Information is not currently available for this nutrient. If you are following a medically restrictive diet, please consult your doctor or registered dietitian before preparing this recipe for personal consumption. Add Your Photo Photos of Cream Cheese Squares 01 of 193 Photo by  Dotdash Meredith Food Studios 02 of 193 Photo by  SillyDip5012 12/23/2024 I make these twice a month I always have cream cheese and biscuits on hand. They need to be refrigerated until needed.I’d do not use the butter, I cut down on the amount of sugar in the cream cheese and I put extra cinnamon on the top.No need for storage, they won’t last that long once your family tastes them. 03 of 193 Photo by  PeppyLeek7697 05/04/2024 A keeper! I used 3 rolls of cressent rolls. 2 just didn't cover like I thought it should. I also used 1/3 cuup sugar and about a Tablespoon of cinnanmon. That was a suggestion from my husband. The first one I made I planned on take to a party. It never made it. We ate it before we could get to the party. LOLOL It is so good & easy to make. I will be making this for the holidays. 04 of 193 Photo by  Kimberly Madigan-Goodall 02/17/2024 It's delicious. So easy to make my husband loves it. ❤️ 05 of 193 Photo by  Marilyn Nguyen 12/12/2023 06 of 193 Photo by  JoyfulOrzo8483 09/20/2023 I haven’t tasted them yet but they look and smell amazing. I wish someone would change up the cook time, because even though it LOOKS done, it more than likely IS NOT! I let mine cook for 30 minutes and then cool for 30 minutes…only to turn around and have to cook it longer because it’s doughy. Looks like you have to burn it if you want the bottom cooked. 😞It’s been cooking for 45-50 minutes and I just decided to pull it out, because I’m tired of waiting. Will try and update with how they taste!UPDATE: Changed from 4 stars to 5 because the taste of these things are amazing!! 😭😭😭 Hoping they taste this amazing in the morning when my fiancé tries them!! 😍😍 07 of 193 Photo by  Jen Witiarz 02/25/2023 So after reading reviews I made some changes. I used puff pastry, 1/2 cup of monk fruit sweetener, 1 egg and the same amount of butter. I put some cinnamon on the bottom pastry, put the cream cheese in, put the second pastry on top, poured the butter on top, used a pastry brush to even out the butter, put the cinnamon on top. Put in the oven for 30 min, turned around half way through added some sugar to the top finished off.It came out really good and the crust came out nice and buttery. 08 of 193 Photo by  HandyBagel3100 07/24/2022 Delicious and simple! Made a batch and a half😋 09 of 193 Photo by  BlueSpoon2729 03/25/2022 This was a quick and easy recipe… I used Butter Flake crescent rolls instead and they were very delicious 🤤😋🤤😋🤤… my co-workers loved them so I sent them the recipe 10 of 193 Photo by  Randy 02/11/2022 I added apple pie filling and came out great! 1 2 3 4 5 Next You’ll Also Love Bake Sale Lemon Bars 1,324 Ratings Lemon Pie Bars 889 Ratings Lemon Square Bars 1,107 Ratings (Gluten Free) Magic Cookie Bars 67 Ratings Oatmeal Jam Squares 50 Ratings Kristen's Awesome Oatmeal Cookies 340 Ratings Caramel Bars 634 Ratings Black Bottom Cream Cheese Chippers 2 Ratings Rice Cereal Energy Bars 78 Ratings Easy Peanut Butter Bars 133 Ratings Fudge Nut Oatmeal Bars 10 Ratings Snickerdoodles I 981 Ratings Frosted Banana Bars 992 Ratings Seven Layer Bars 686 Ratings Oatie Petes 3 Ratings Apple Squares 1,537 Ratings Allrecipes Newsletters Follow Us Dinners Meals Ingredients Occasions Cuisines Kitchen Tips News Features About Us Editorial Process Privacy Policy Product Vetting Terms of Service Advertise Careers Contact Your Privacy Choices   Allrecipes is part of the Dotdash Meredith publishing family. name: Ann

Dotdash Meredith Food Studios;Mix together cream cheese, 1 cup sugar, and vanilla in a medium bowl until smooth and creamy. Spread over crescent dough layer.
